definition: first tone in Mandarin/high, level tone
(prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: And the first cuckoo's melancholy cry.
sentences.chinese: 还有那杜鹃的第一声忧郁叫唤。

sentences.english: They waited for the first cannon-shot.
sentences.chinese: 人们等待着第一声炮响。

sentences.english: I heard the first wave of the rising tide.
sentences.chinese: 我听见涨潮的第一声海浪。
听见可怕的第一声闹铃。

sentences.english: Then the first blast went off, and the grim quiet erupted into pandemonium.
sentences.chinese: 接着第一声爆炸响起，肃静瞬间变成一片混乱。

sentences.english: With the first cock crewing , the day broke.
The farmer gets up as soon as he hear the first cockcrow.
sentences.chinese: 一听到第一声公鸡的啼叫这位农民就起床了。

sentences.english: The first tone is high and stable, like a soprano note.
sentences.chinese: 第一声又高又平，像音乐中的高音。

sentences.english: But as soon as they heard the first cockcrow, they quickly got back into the box.
sentences.chinese: 但他们一听到第一声鸡啼时便很快回到盒子里面去。

sentences.english: Content Abstract: "Turn a somersault and make a wish, " Pap tells Polly when they hear the first whippoorwill of summer.
sentences.chinese: 当听到夏天的第一声夜莺鸣啼时，爸爸对波莉说。

definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声/the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin
yelling (sound made by person)/barking/braying/roaring (sound made by animals)
first tone in Mandarin (high, level tone)
sound of gunfire/fig. news of momentous events
